intro: Fedia muricata, commonly known as the rough-leaved fedia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Fedia muricata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
